product_overview: ADYATAMA SCHOOL is a comprehensive Content Management System (CMS) built on the CodeIgniter 4 framework for educational institutions. It features a responsive admin dashboard themed with Admin LTE (Bootstrap 5) to manage school content and operations efficiently, including articles, media, school staff, galleries, and system settings with SEO capabilities.
core_goals: Enable secure user authentication with role-based access control (RBAC) to restrict and manage access.
Facilitate content management including posts, categories, tags, static pages, and multimedia galleries.
Provide efficient management for school personnel data such as teachers and staff.
Support user engagement through comments and reactions with moderation features.
Ensure SEO optimization through meta management per content entity.
Offer administrative insights via dashboards and activity logs to monitor content activity and user interactions.
Simplify system configuration and global settings management in a centralized interface.
Automate scheduled publishing of content through a cron-based scheduler.
Maintain a modular, extensible codebase built on modern PHP practices with CodeIgniter 4.
key_features: Authentication module with login, logout, and RBAC enforcing permissions per user role.
Admin Dashboard displaying site statistics including posts, users, views, and recent activities with chart visualizations.
Posts management with CRUD operations, rich text editing (CKEditor 5), SEO settings, and media uploading capabilities.
Category and tag management supporting unique slugs and inline editing for tags.
Media library supporting upload, automatic thumbnailing, and file management.
Guru & Staff management module to handle school personnel data with photo uploads and role filters.
Static pages module for managing school information pages with SEO metadata editing.
Galleries management for organizing photo/video albums with drag-and-drop sorting.
System settings panel grouped by general, contact, and SEO categories with caching for better performance.
User engagement features including reactions via API endpoints and comment moderation interface.
Activity log module tracking user actions such as login and content CRUD operations.
Scheduled publishing feature operated via CLI command and cron jobs for automated content release.
user_flow_summary: Users authenticate via a secure login page enforcing role-based permissions to access modules.
Admins navigate the dashboard to view real-time statistics and recent activity summaries.
Content creators use the posts management UI to create, edit, and schedule articles enriched with SEO tags and media.
Media uploads performed through a unified library supporting various file types and automatic sizing.
Admin users manage school personnel data, galleries, and static pages through dedicated modules with appropriate forms and lists.
Engagement is managed through comment moderation panels and API-driven reaction updates without page reloads.
System administrators configure site-wide settings including contact information and SEO options in a structured interface.
Scheduled posts are automatically published by the system based on configured publish dates via the CLI scheduler and cron triggers.
Activity logs are accessible for auditing all user actions within the admin area to maintain transparency and security.
validation_criteria: All authentication flows must enforce RBAC and session security with tests for unauthorized access.
CRUD operations for posts, categories, tags, pages, galleries, media, and personnel must pass input validation and persistence tests.
SEO metadata management must reflect correctly in page rendering and meta tags.
Media upload functionality should validate files and generate required thumbnails consistently.
Dashboard statistics and charts must accurately represent current data from posts, users, views, and comments.
Reaction API endpoints must update counts asynchronously and reflect updated totals immediately.
Comment moderation interface must allow approve, edit, and delete actions with immediate UI feedback.
Activity logs should record all specified user actions with timestamps and user identifiers.
Scheduled publishing commands must publish content exactly at configured times with automated tests simulating cron execution.
System settings changes must persist and cache properly, reflecting immediately in the application behavior.
User interface must be responsive and compatible across supported browsers and screen sizes.
